descript.abstract: This EnviroAtlas dataset shows the block group population that is within and beyond an easy walking distance (500m) of a park entrance. Park entrances were included in this analysis if they were within 5km of the EnviroAtlas community boundary. This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas. EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: The purpose of this data is to show the block group population with and without service of a park. This data can be assessed with other socio-economic factors to identify areas of need. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

overview.eaover:
For more information about EnviroAtlas data, go to https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets.
The attributes describe the population and percentage of the block group population that are within walking distance (500 meters) of a park entrance.
The processing steps were completed using Python scripts.
A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps.
When calculating the EnviroAtlas Dasymetric Population Map, people are not allocated to certain land cover types or areas with steep slopes. REPLACE-MISSPOP All percentages were calculated using the total dasymetric population per block group, rather than the census population for accuracy's sake.
IWDP = In Walking Distance of a Park entrance BWDP = Beyond Walking Distance of a Park entrance
